subject: Re: File from tonight
author: bhali333
full_text:
Steve,
I will not get into another debate, your right I don't know what you 
have been as of late. My comment was based on the many sessions we 
had done together in the past. I respect your right to do your 
research however you see fit, but remember I knew you when ! So lets 
end this thread right here.

bruce









--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...> wrote:
>
> Bruce,
> 
> I haven't asked for mike and lisa in quite a while because i felt 
it 
> was silly doing that.  Maybe crutch was a poor choice of words on 
my 
> part, but we all have opinions and so far no one is right. 
Remember, 
> we both have the same techs??  So, i figured to turn it on and ask 
> who wants to speak with me and give others a chance to speak.  Mike 
> and Lisa still come through every session in their same voice just 
to 
> let me know they are there if i need them.  Besides i feel that 
they 
> must be busy getting loaned out to everybody.  My communication has 
> escalated to a better level recently and i know we have worked 
> together in the past, but we haven't in about a month and a half so 
> don't tell others on here how i do box sessions.  You really don't 
> know what i'm doing and would only give new researchers bad 
> information.  Although we should all work together at this, we all 
> have different methods and that's what keep us tuned in to this 
> message board every day.  Bruce, this is not an argument from me at 
> all and i do respect what you do.  We just do things very 
differently 
> now and that's why we no longer do research together, but a 
different 
> point of view is also good sometimes.
> 
> -Steve H.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, bruce halliday 
> <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:
> >
> > 
> > Robin,
> >  
> > I agree with Steve on a couple of points. First let me say that I
> > do believe that we all have a "technician/guide/guardian" call 
them 
> what you
> > may. but I usually call them by the names they introduced 
> themselves by.
> >  
> > I know for a fact through many, many, many box sessions that when 
I 
> turn
> > a box on, could be Frank's box or the minibox or the RS 470 does 
> not matter which.
> >  
> > The same two entities will come through immediately, So much so 
> now, that I do not even ask for conformation that
> > it is in fact them. I recognise their individual voice patterns. 
I 
> have built a solid relationship with these two spirits
> > I know as mike and Lisa so much so that I have even gotten to 
know 
> their individual personalities.
> >  
> > There are other newer researchers here that will attest to the 
fact 
> that when they where doing their first sessions
> > I had asked my two "Friends" Mike and Lisa to assist in getting 
> them started and invariably the spirits that came 
> > through to these new researchers during their first sessions 
> identified themselves as Mike and Lisa.
> >  
> > Steve says he does not turn on his box and use them as a crutch, 
> that is not entirely true. I had done research 
> > very closely with Steve until recently and I would venture to say 
> that 99% if not every session he starts with "Mike & Lisa
> > are you available to talk with me" 
> >  
> > Also I don't consider working with my technicians as using them 
as 
> a crutch, They would not allow that.
> > They are not there like butlers at our beckoned call when we feel 
> they may be of some use.
> > Quite the opposite, without them we would get no communication at 
> all, they are allowing us the honor of receiving this 
> > celestial communication. They are the moderators, facilitators 
and 
> generators of all we hear and send to and from the spirit realm.
> > And they also stand as guards and protectors to do the best they 
> can to keep us from being deceived or taken down a dark path.
> >  
> > Some here wait for others to state an opinion and then tend to 
> agree with that opinion no matter what they have experienced to be 
> true.
> >  
> > Robin, my advice to you as a new researcher in this field. Form 
> your own beliefs through your experience and research.
> > Listen and learn from others but do not let what you believe to 
be 
> true or not, be swayed by popular opinion.
> >  
> > Bruce
> > Bruce Halliday 
> > 
> > 
> > To: EVP-ITC@: MudPuddleFarm@: Sat, 2 Feb 2008 21:42:09 -
> 0800Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > Steve,
> >  
> > I certainly appreciate your thoughts.  In the back of my mind is 
> always the question of whether we are being Deceived.  Just for the 
> sake of argument, is it POSSIBLE we're being manipulated by 
something 
> evil?  I'm not frightened, and I won't stop my own research (the 
> negative stuff just makes me more determined), but my mind does go 
> there sometimes.  I hope that along with developing my "ear" I can 
> acquire the gift of discernment.
> >  
> > Robin
> >  
> >  
> > 
> > ----- Original Message ----- 
> > From: Steve Hultay 
> > To: EVP-ITC@...m 
> > Sent: Saturday, February 02, 2008 8:57 PM
> > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from tonight:
> > 
> > 
> > Robin,If i may add my thoughts on this: There is no concrete 
> evidence of who or what comes through is what they say they are. 
> Technicians i have found were used to get you up and running and i 
> only now call on them if i need assistance. I don't turn the boxes 
on 
> and ask for them like a crutch, i conduct my session and if i need 
> help they will supply it to me if needed. I think the whole idea is 
> to find out who we are communicating with, maybe we will never 
really 
> know for sure but i still try and find out as best as i can. -Steve 
> H.--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Robin Searcy Henson" 
> <MudPuddleFarm@> wrote:>> Hi Frank, > > When you mention being 
> distrustful of what comes through the boxes, are you saying you're 
> skeptical of the "technicians" being who they say they are? Not 
> trying to open another can of worms here, just wanting to continue 
> learning from your experience and research. I get what you're 
saying 
> about becoming obsessive with the sessions. I've probably asked you 
> this a half dozen times over the last couple of years, but who or 
> what do YOU think you're/we're communicating with?> > Robin> > > ---
--
>  Original Message ----- > From: 
> purplespacefriend<mailto:purplealiengirl@> > To: EVP-
> ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> > Sent: 
Saturday, 
> February 02, 2008 7:46 PM> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: File from 
tonight> 
> > > Have ya tried EVPmaker? It is based on that random principle, 
and 
> > predates the boxes.> > I've heard this stuff before, about random 
> being the best, and I > have to disaggree. I also think it unwise 
to 
> spend every waking > moment doing sessions. I think it creates that 
> expectation, and > perhaps desperation to make contact, and I would 
> tend not to trust > what comes through. > > I don't trust some of 
> this stuff because I have yet get any > meaningful assistence with 
> the boxes from the so called technicians. > All I ever got was a 
> telepathic "suggestion" to use the echo boxes. > Everything else 
was 
> a assemblage of stuff I had worked on in hte past > to solve the 
> problem of "what else could I use". > > I hate to see yet another 
go 
> down the road of "this is the onlyest > way". > > Frank-S>
> >
